intro: Diplusodon hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy tailed mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. Diplusodon hirtellus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
